description: Tomhe (short for "Tom Herman") created the FlipJump programming language to be simple and primitive (known as OISC, which stands for "One Instruction Set Computer" language. OISC languages are straightforward, running from only one instruction (FipJump programs run from one instruction with two operands : a;b ).
NOTE: You can find more information about the Flipjump Memory format on the project's GitHub page.
